Subject: RE: [junit] Preventing JUnit from stopping on failures.

> Aside from this, having multiple assertions within a single test is
> actually the problem - you want to be aiming for one assertion per
> test, not multiple.

Well, personally I don't see any problems with more than one assertion per
test, if the assertions are highly interrelated.

I agree, though, that the desire to have a test continue after a failed
assertion is an indicator of tests that test to much at once.

Cheers, Ilja
